title: String Matching
description:
String Matching

Check if string B can be formed using letters from string A, where each letter in A can be used at most once.

Examples:

  • Input: A = "aab", B = "ab"
    Output: true
    Explanation: Can use 1 'a' and 1 'b' from A to form B
  • Input: A = "ab", B = "aab"
    Output: false
    Explanation: Need 2 'a's but A only has 1 'a'

Constraints:

  • Both strings can be empty
  • Case-sensitive matching
solution_text:
String Matching

Algorithm:

  1. Count frequency of characters in both strings
  2. Check if A has at least as many of each character as B needs

Time Complexity: O(n + m) - count both strings

Space Complexity: O(1) - limited character set

Key Insights:

  • Counter provides efficient frequency counting for comparison
  • Missing characters in count_A default to 0 (Counter behavior)
  • Empty string B can be formed from any string A (true case)
  • Order of characters doesn't matter, only frequencies
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the matching result"""
    def bool_to_string(val):
        return 'true' if val else 'false'
    
    # Convert expected output string to boolean for comparison
    expected_bool = expected_output == 'true' if isinstance(expected_output, str) else expected_output
    
    passed = actual_output == expected_bool
    output_str = bool_to_string(actual_output)
    
    return [passed, output_str]
